description: From Latin stāmina, plural of stāmen.

entries.meaning: The energy and strength for continuing to do something over a long period of time; power of sustained exertion, or resistance to hardship, illness etc.
examples: He has a lot of stamina. I suppose that's why he can run for a long time.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, uncountable, plural only) The basic elements of a thing; rudimentary structures or qualities.

examples: In the specimens we have examined, and which perhaps have been rendered luxuriant by culture, the number of stamina has been from twelve to sixteen; of styles, from six to eight; of flowers on the same stalk, from one to eight.
